intro: Aeonium canariense subsp. virgineum, commonly known as the Canary Island aeonium, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture, adapted to store water. It produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
